<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 277, 178, 293]]<|/det|>

0625/31  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 301, 265, 317]]<|/det|>
Paper 3 Theory (Core)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[777, 301, 905, 317]]<|/det|>
May/June 2023  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 326, 905, 342]]<|/det|>
1 hour 15 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 395, 371]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 359, 400]]<|/det|>
No additional materials are needed.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 230, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 808, 574]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You may use a calculator.- You should show all your working and use appropriate units.- Take the weight of \(1.0 \text{kg}\) to be \(9.8 \text{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 9.8 \text{m/s}^2\)).  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 603, 220, 618]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 619, 730, 651]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 80.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 569, 90]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 289, 685, 308]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 428, 529, 447]]<|/det|>
A builder starts to raise one end of the beam.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 459, 920, 495]]<|/det|>
He uses a force of \(1030\mathrm{N}\) at a perpendicular distance of \(120\mathrm{cm}\) from the pivot. Fig. 2.2 shows the arrangement.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 73, 97, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 658, 91]]<|/det|>
Electricity is distributed from wind turbines to homes and industry.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 103, 144, 121]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 102, 920, 135]]<|/det|>
Statements A–F describe the main stages in the transfer of energy from the Sun to electrical energy in a wind turbine generator.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 134, 556, 152]]<|/det|>
The statements A–F are not in the correct order.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 165, 173, 183]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 164, 747, 183]]<|/det|>
Air moves from regions of high pressure to regions of low pressure.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 181, 173, 199]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 180, 490, 199]]<|/det|>
The turbine blades turn a generator.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 197, 171, 215]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 197, 636, 215]]<|/det|>
Energy from the Sun heats the atmosphere unevenly.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 212, 171, 230]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 211, 910, 228]]<|/det|>
Uneven heating of the atmosphere produces regions of different atmospheric pressure.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 227, 173, 245]]<|/det|>
<label>E</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 227, 541, 245]]<|/det|>
The generator produces electrical energy.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 243, 173, 261]]<|/det|>
<label>F</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 243, 487, 261]]<|/det|>
Moving air turns the turbine blades.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 274, 920, 306]]<|/det|>
Complete the flow chart to describe how a wind turbine uses energy from the Sun to generate electrical energy. Insert the missing letters in the empty boxes.
